verses.kjv: Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said unto his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
verses.ct: When Jacob learned that grain was available in Egypt, he asked his sons, "Why are you all just standing around looking at each other?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
verses.ct: He continued, "Listen, I've heard there's grain in Egypt. Go down there and buy some for us so we can survive instead of starving to death."

verses.kjv: And Joseph’s ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
verses.ct: So 10 of Joseph's brothers traveled down to Egypt to purchase grain.

verses.kjv: But Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure mischief befall him.
verses.ct: But Jacob didn't send Benjamin, Joseph's younger brother, along with them, because he said, "Something terrible might happen to him."

verses.kjv: And the sons of Israel came to buy corn among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
verses.ct: The sons of Israel were among the many people who came to buy grain, because the famine had spread to the land of Canaan as well.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph’s brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
verses.ct: Now Joseph was the ruler in charge of the country, and he was the one who sold grain to everyone. When his brothers arrived, they bowed low before him with their faces to the ground.

verses.kjv: And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
verses.ct: Joseph recognized his brothers the moment he saw them, but he pretended to be a stranger and spoke harshly to them. "Where did you come from?" he demanded. They answered, "From the land of Canaan, to purchase food."

verses.kjv: And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
verses.ct: So Joseph recognized his brothers, but they had no idea who he was.

verses.kjv: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
verses.ct: Then Joseph remembered the dreams he had once dreamed about them, and he said, "You're spies! You've come to scout out the weak points of this country."

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy servants come.
verses.ct: "No, my lord!" they replied. "Your servants have only come to buy food."

verses.kjv: We are all one man’s sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.
verses.ct: "We're all sons of the same man. We're honest people — your servants are not spies."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
verses.ct: But he insisted, "No — you've come to scout out the vulnerable areas of this land."

verses.kjv: And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
verses.ct: They explained, "Your servants are 12 brothers, sons of one man back in Canaan. The youngest is still at home with our father, and one brother is gone."

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, That is it that I spake unto you, saying, Ye are spies:
verses.ct: Joseph replied, "It's exactly as I told you — you're spies!"

verses.kjv: Hereby ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.
verses.ct: "Here's how you'll be tested: I swear by Pharaoh's life, you will not leave this place unless your youngest brother comes here."

verses.kjv: Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether there be any truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies.
verses.ct: "Send one of you to go get your brother while the rest of you remain locked up. That way your claims can be tested to see if there's any truth in what you're saying. Otherwise, I swear by Pharaoh's life, you are definitely spies."

verses.kjv: And he put them all together into ward three days.
verses.ct: Then he had them all thrown into custody for 3 days.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live; for I fear God:
verses.ct: On the 3rd day, Joseph told them, "Do what I say and you'll live, because I deeply revere God."

verses.kjv: If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses:
verses.ct: "If you're really honest men, let one of your brothers stay here, locked up in this prison, while the rest of you go and take grain back to your hungry families."

verses.kjv: But bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.
verses.ct: "But you must bring your youngest brother back to me. That will prove your story is true, and you won't be executed." They agreed to this.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, We are verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
verses.ct: They said to each other, "We're clearly being punished because of what we did to our brother. We saw how desperate and anguished he was when he begged us for mercy, but we refused to listen. That's why this trouble has come on us."

verses.kjv: And Reuben answered them, saying, Spake I not unto you, saying, Do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his blood is required.
verses.ct: Reuben responded, "Didn't I tell you not to harm the boy? But you wouldn't listen. Now we're being held accountable for his blood."

verses.kjv: And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.
verses.ct: They didn't realize that Joseph could understand them, since he had been using an interpreter to communicate with them.

verses.kjv: And he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
verses.ct: Joseph turned away from them and wept. Then he composed himself, came back, and spoke with them again. He selected Simeon and had him tied up right in front of them.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to restore every man’s money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he unto them.
verses.ct: Joseph then ordered his servants to fill their bags with grain, to secretly put each man's payment back in his bag, and to give them supplies for the journey. All of this was done.

verses.kjv: And they laded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
verses.ct: They loaded the grain onto their donkeys and left.

verses.kjv: And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it was in his sack’s mouth.
verses.ct: When they stopped for the night, one of them opened his bag to feed his donkey and discovered his money right there at the top of the bag.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God hath done unto us?
verses.ct: He told his brothers, "My money has been put back — look, it's right here in my bag!" Their hearts sank and they trembled, saying to each other, "What is God doing to us?"

verses.kjv: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan, and told him all that befell unto them; saying,
verses.ct: When they arrived back home to their father Jacob in Canaan, they told him everything that had happened to them.

verses.kjv: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
verses.ct: "The man who governs the country spoke harshly to us and accused us of being spies."

verses.kjv: And we said unto him, We are true men; we are no spies:
verses.ct: "We told him, 'We're honest people, not spies.'"

verses.kjv: We be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
verses.ct: "'We're 12 brothers, sons of one father. One brother is gone, and the youngest is still with our father in Canaan.'"

verses.kjv: And the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, Hereby shall I know that ye are true men; leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your households, and be gone:
verses.ct: "Then the man, the ruler of the country, said to us, 'Here's how I'll know you're honest: Leave one of your brothers with me, take grain for your starving households, and go.'"

verses.kjv: And bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: so will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.
verses.ct: "'Bring your youngest brother back to me. Then I'll know you're not spies but honest men. I'll release your brother to you, and you'll be free to trade in the land.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man’s bundle of money was in his sack: and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
verses.ct: As they emptied their bags, every single one of them found his money pouch inside his bag. When they and their father saw the money, they were terrified.

verses.kjv: And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away: all these things are against me.
verses.ct: Their father Jacob said to them, "You've robbed me of my children! Joseph is gone, Simeon is gone, and now you want to take Benjamin too. Everything is working against me!"

verses.kjv: And Reuben spake unto his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
verses.ct: Reuben said to his father, "You may put my own 2 sons to death if I don't bring him back to you. Entrust him to my care, and I will return him to you."

verses.kjv: And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
verses.ct: But Jacob replied, "My son will not go down there with you. His brother is dead, and he's the only one left. If something terrible happens to him on the journey, you'll send this old man to the grave in grief."
